key_insight: AuditDM trains an MLLM as an automated auditor (via reinforcement learning) to generate questions and counterfactual images that intentionally maximize disagreement across models, revealing actionable capability gaps and enabling targeted fixes.
problem_solved: Conventional evaluations for multimodal LLMs are often opaque and miss important, model-specific failure modes; AuditDM systematically discovers and helps rectify those hidden capability gaps.
method: Fine-tune an MLLM as an auditor using reinforcement learning with an objective to maximize divergence among a set of target models.
Automatically generate challenging queries and counterfactual images that expose disagreement-driven failure modes.
Use the discovered disagreements to create targeted interventions (e.g., focused data augmentation or targeted fine-tuning) to rectify model weaknesses.
impact: Provides AI/ML teams a practical, interpretable workflow to surface model blind spots, prioritize remediation, and measurably improve multimodal model robustness and reliability.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: Auditor (MLLM + RL) → generates questions & counterfactuals → measures model disagreement → targeted remediation loop
Heatmap or matrix showing disagreement scores across models and task categories to highlight capability gaps
Side-by-side examples of original vs counterfactual images with model responses to illustrate failure modes
Before/after bar chart showing performance improvements after targeted rectification (e.g., reduced disagreement or higher accuracy)
paper_title: Differences That Matter: Auditing Models for Capability Gap Discovery and Rectification
paper_authors: Qihao Liu, Chengzhi Mao, Yaojie Liu, Alan Yuille, Wen-Sheng Chu
